item.title: 275 – Lymon, Singing
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Lymon, Singing in profile, man inside, eyes closed, humming in time, then slowly singing, soft a tender tenor-high floating out of reach of the other men stirring low, knuckling at the table above, tinkling in time his glass against the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Lymon, Singing

in profile, man inside, eyes
closed, humming
in time, then slowly singing, soft
a tender tenor-high floating
out of reach
of the other men stirring
low, knuckling at the table
above, tinkling in time his glass
against the whiskey bottle,
slap-clap of hands and feet
on pine boards, rough
the room built from scratch
on that tiny stage his hand
of a sudden held high, trembling
lifted up before crash!
to the table top
hymn-singing hard now, sweating
the sweetness out
his work shirt stained
a dark line down his back
each of them the same dark
line Lymon singing, tender
-tenor, high above it all,
floating

item.title: 274 – Votive
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Votive Light a candle in the tiled cathedral of the bathroom. Pray the litany of what the fuck in the dark. Feel more than the blanket soft and close. No hands will come in the way we long for hands. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Votive

Light a candle
in the tiled cathedral
of the bathroom.

Pray the litany
of what the fuck
in the dark.

Feel more
than the blanket
soft and close.

No hands
will come in the way
we long for hands.

Swirl the circle
of your face in the mirror.
See what is

there in the flickering: smile
at the little death.
Take it into the world.

See what fire it starts.

item.title: 273 – Animosity
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Animosity such a strange fitting slicker seal skin skinned stretched oily tight it wears hot and close to the skin don’t breathe repelling everyday rain hung in the hall with the other coats takes shape a pup wailing in the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Animosity

such a strange
fitting slicker

seal skin skinned
stretched oily tight

it wears hot and close
to the skin

don’t breathe
repelling everyday rain

hung in the hall
with the other coats

takes shape
a pup wailing

in the dark
see it?

wrist-deep
in dishwater

each fork
a sharp rebuke

each saucer
a potential shard

in blunt
hands

item.title: 272 – Four Skulls
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Four Skulls Four skulls (red, blue, black, yellow) stare out from the slabbed mantel hung on tiny nails a sad family of frowns zippered across absent lips keep watch over this house and all who shelter here
item.content:encoded:
Four Skulls

Four skulls (red,
blue, black, yellow) stare out
from the slabbed mantel
hung on tiny nails
a sad family of frowns
zippered across absent lips
keep watch over this house
and all who shelter here

item.title: 271 – Terza Rima
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Terza Rima Years later Boccaccio would christen it divina, elevating it into something greater than it had been to Dante it was just la commedia his broken life woken in the middle of a dark wood in Tuscany, hunting the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Terza Rima

Years later Boccaccio
would christen it
divina, elevating it
into something greater
than it had been

to Dante
it was just la commedia
his broken life
woken in the middle
of a dark wood
in Tuscany, hunting
the next step

finding solace
in the form
and freedom
of rhyme, choosing
a descent into Hell
in hopes
of climbing out again

item.title: 270 – Baggage Claim
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Baggage Claim A humbling thought sneaks in under the haze of jet lag, lumped in with the oddly personal luggage just off American Airlines 2211 with service from DFW buckling along the shifting silver plate tectonics of baggage carousel #9: … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Baggage Claim

A humbling thought sneaks in
under the haze of jet lag, lumped in
with the oddly personal luggage
just off American Airlines 2211
with service from DFW
buckling along the shifting silver
plate tectonics of baggage carousel #9:
the world we leave and return to so easily
doesn’t need us, doesn’t even think
of us–it just keeps running along
like we weren’t there when in fact
we were all along somewhere, though where is
the fixed nut of a problem we spin around.
What is gone? Or here? Such tesseraction
is too much after canned air and the swollen skin
of half-sleep, packed with other people’s dreams.
The travel-addled brain is fit only to watch
the bags’ slow spin, waiting to collect mine
when it’s finally disgorged, carry it to the curb,
raise a hand to hail a taxi and head for home.

item.title: 269 – DFW>PDX
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: DFW>PDX I wake from a bad nap with a crick in my neck to the end of a heavily edited version of The Godfather. Brando’s bloated face is all orange peel and smiles and then he’s dead in the tomatoes. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
DFW>PDX

I wake from a bad nap
with a crick in my neck to the end
of a heavily edited version of The Godfather.
Brando’s bloated face is all orange peel
and smiles and then he’s dead in the tomatoes.
We shudder sudden and I think we must be
on a train car in the middle of Sicily, not
hurling ourselves over the emptiness
of Texas. Deep in the heart. I drift again
after awhile, dreaming the Archangel Michael
Correleone–in nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti
Amen–bowing at the font of his son.
Fredo, Sonny, Luca Brazi: all sleeping with the fishes.
And the long slow crawl of Texas unspooling
and no runway for miles.

item.title: 268 – Keep Walking
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Keep Walking Walk the particular path your feet find. Stroll past my door now and again. Welcome me as I wander late nights with a cup and candle whenever it is I arrive. Walk the particular path your feet find. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Keep Walking

Walk the particular path your feet find.
Stroll past my door now and again.
Welcome me as I wander late nights
with a cup and candle whenever it is I arrive.

Walk the particular path your feet find.
Send updates once in a while, marked
by the distant lands you come across.
Use your mind and strength in what ways seems best.
Raise up new ways of making you never knew.
Rest often.

Just keep walking, whatever path
your feet have found for you.
Wide and well traveled or lonely
and known only to you, it matters not.
Only keep walking.

item.title: 267 – Sevilla
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Sevilla Rain in Sevilla Shelter in a door way Best moment all day
item.content:encoded:
Sevilla

Rain in Sevilla
Shelter in a door way
Best moment all day

item.title: 266 – Madrid
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Madrid I made a mistake getting the cortado She sleeps on my shoulder past Palencia, Valladolid, into the mouth of Madrid The car is full of the soft lisp of old Castellanos I appear in the glare of the window … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Madrid

I made a mistake
getting the cortado

She sleeps on my shoulder
past Palencia, Valladolid,
into the mouth of Madrid

The car is full of the soft lisp
of old Castellanos

I appear in the glare
of the window as a face
full of all the lights

I can’t catch
or understand

Her cafe con leche has a cold skin
and will not sit well

She shuffles against me
shifting my attention
from the window
and all that passes
